Sprite Generation

Add new svg file to '/source/sprites/svg/css (for background images)

Add new svg file to '/source/sprites/svg/inline' (for layered inline icons)

How to generate the 'background image sprite' and matching scss file.

In Patterns Library:

  1. Copy/paste any new svg files that need to be added to the background sprite into '/source/sprites/svg/css'.
  2. Run 'gulp' in the Terminal window.
  3. 'gulp' finishes a bunch of processes. When done, all svg graphics in this folder ('/source/sprites/svg/css') will be combined into 1 svg file here: '/source/build/out/images/svg-sprite.css-(something).svg'. The (something) is a random number generated at the same time the file gets generated. Also the file '/source/build/out/sprite.scss' is updated with css to control how to show the specific graphics in this 1 svg file.

In PSRM:

  1. Grab the file '/source/build/out/images/svg-sprite.css-(something).svg' from Patterns Library
  2. Rename the file to 'svg-sprite.css-current.svg'
  3. Move file to '/images/svg/' in the PSRM project
  4. Grab the scss file '/source/build/out/sprite.scss' from the Patterns Library
  5. Move it to '/content/styles/sprite-generated/' in the PSRM project
  6. Edit line 1 of this scss file to point to the svg file you moved first: basically replace the line '$svg-sprite-url: "/images/svg-sprite.css-f4e3c5b6.svg";' with '$svg-sprite-url: "/images/svg/svg-sprite.css-current.svg";'
  7. Add a css class in 'box.scss' to compile the mixin var for example: .braket-right{ @include svg-sprite('braket-right'); }
  8. Now the class will work!

How to generate the layered svg file.

In Patterns Library:

  1. Copy/paste any new svg files that need to be added to the layered sprite into '/source/sprites/svg/inline/'. *the name of the file will be used later*
  2. Run 'gulp' in the Terminal window.
  3. 'gulp dist' finishes a bunch of processes. When done, all svg graphics in this folder ('/source/sprites/svg/css') will be combined into 1 svg file here: '/static/images/symbol/svg/sprite.symbol.svg'.
  4. Edit the file '/source/patterns/01-elements/icons/01-inline-svg-icons.hbs' (not part of the creation process but it is so that we can see it here on the patterns library site on the 'icons page').

In PSRM:

  1. Grab file '/static/images/symbol/svg/sprite.symbol.svg'.
  2. Move file to '/NoCDN/svg/' in the PSRM project
  3. Now you can reference the name of the file like so (using the original file name 'phone.svg' for example) : 
<p>Add new svg file to '/source/sprites/svg/css (for background images)</p>

<p>Add new svg file to '/source/sprites/svg/inline' (for layered inline icons)</p>


<h2>How to generate the 'background image sprite' and matching scss file.</h2>
<p>In Patterns Library:</p>
<ol>
<li>Copy/paste any new svg files that need to be added to the background sprite into '/source/sprites/svg/css'.</li>
<li>Run 'gulp' in the Terminal window. </li>
<li>'gulp' finishes a bunch of processes. When done, all svg graphics in this folder ('/source/sprites/svg/css') will be combined into 1 svg file here: '/source/build/out/images/svg-sprite.css-(something).svg'. The (something) is a random number generated at the same time the file gets generated. Also the file '/source/build/out/sprite.scss' is updated with css to control how to show the specific graphics in this 1 svg file.</li>
</ol>
<p>In PSRM:</p>
<ol>
<li>Grab the file '/source/build/out/images/svg-sprite.css-(something).svg' from Patterns Library</li>
<li>Rename the file to 'svg-sprite.css-current.svg'</li>
<li>Move file to '/images/svg/' in the PSRM project</li>
<li>Grab the scss file '/source/build/out/sprite.scss' from the Patterns Library</li>

<li>Move it to '/content/styles/sprite-generated/' in the PSRM project</li>
<li>Edit line 1 of this scss file to point to the svg file you moved first: basically replace the line '$svg-sprite-url: "/images/svg-sprite.css-f4e3c5b6.svg";' with '$svg-sprite-url: "/images/svg/svg-sprite.css-current.svg";'</li>
<li>Add a css class in 'box.scss' to compile the mixin var for example:

.braket-right{ 

    @include svg-sprite('braket-right');

}
</li>
<li>Now the class will work!</li>
</ol>

<h2>How to generate the layered svg file.</h2>
<p>In Patterns Library:</p>
<ol>
<li>Copy/paste any new svg files that need to be added to the layered sprite into '/source/sprites/svg/inline/'. *the name of the file will be used later*</li>
<li>Run 'gulp' in the Terminal window. </li>
<li>'gulp dist' finishes a bunch of processes. When done, all svg graphics in this folder ('/source/sprites/svg/css') will be combined into 1 svg file here: '/static/images/symbol/svg/sprite.symbol.svg'.</li>
<li>Edit the file '/source/patterns/01-elements/icons/01-inline-svg-icons.hbs' (not part of the creation process but it is so that we can see it here on the patterns library site on the 'icons page').
</li>
</ol>
<p>In PSRM:</p>
<ol>
<li>Grab file '/static/images/symbol/svg/sprite.symbol.svg'.</li>
<li>Move file to '/NoCDN/svg/' in the PSRM project</li>
<li>Now you can reference the name of the file like so (using the original file name 'phone.svg' for example) :     <svg class="icon">
      <use xlink:href="/images/symbol/svg/sprite.symbol.svg#phone" />
    </svg></li>
</ol>
